overview: The purpose of this Act is to establish a three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the second, third, and fifth circuits. [1] This program is intended to acknowledge the distinct pathways that lead women into the criminal justice system and address their individualized needs. [1] The bill requires the judiciary to submit a report of its findings and recommendations to the governor and legislature prior to the regular sessions of 2026, 2027, and 2028, and the Act will be repealed on June 30, 2028. [1]
appropriations: There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum of $ (HB727) or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2026-2027. [1] The unspecified sums are for equipment; mental health, substance abuse treatment, and other services; and the establishment of seven temporary positions. [1] The sums appropriated shall be expended by the judiciary for the purposes of this Act. [1]
assumptions_and_methodology: The provided legislative documents do not specify the assumptions or methodology used to determine the necessary appropriation amount for the women's court pilot program. [1] The bill leaves the appropriation amount blank for fiscal years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027. [1] The cost estimation methods and data sources used for financial projections are not detailed in the bill. [1]
agency_impact: There is established within the second, third, and fifth circuits of the judiciary the women's court pilot program. [1] The bill requires the establishment of seven temporary positions, including social worker V, social worker IV, circuit court clerk II, and judicial clerk positions to support the program. [1] The judiciary shall be responsible for expending the appropriated sums and must submit annual reports on the program's status and recommendations to the legislature. [1]
economic_impact: The pilot program aims to provide services to women in the court system with the goal of diverting participants from incarceration, supporting their success in the community, and reducing recidivism. [1] By focusing on non-violent women who are at high risk of recidivism, the program may reduce long-term costs associated with incarceration. [1] As of August 2024, a similar program in the first circuit had twenty-three women participating. [1]
policy_impact: This Act builds upon Act 243, Session Laws of Hawaii 2022, which established a three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the first circuit. [1] It expands this initiative by establishing a temporary three-year woman's court pilot program within the second, third, and fifth circuits. [1] The judiciary's recommendations will determine whether the pilot program should continue, expand, or be discontinued after its repeal date of June 30, 2028. [1]
revenue_sources: There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii an unspecified sum for the program. [1] The bill specifies this appropriation is for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum for fiscal year 2026-2027. [1] No other revenue sources are mentioned in the provided document. [1]
six_year_fiscal_implications: The bill appropriates an unspecified sum from the general revenues for fiscal year 2025-2026. [1] The same unspecified sum is appropriated for fiscal year 2026-2027. [1] These funds are for equipment, mental health and substance abuse treatment services, and the establishment of seven temporary positions. [1] The temporary positions include social worker V, social worker IV, circuit court clerk II, and judicial clerk positions. [1] The Act establishes a three-year pilot program, but appropriations are only specified for the first two fiscal years. [1] The program is set to be repealed on June 30, 2028. [1] The judiciary is required to submit a report with recommendations on whether the program should continue, expand, or be discontinued. [1] Any fiscal implications beyond the three-year pilot period are contingent on future legislative action based on these recommendations. [1]
operating_revenue_impact: The provided legislative document does not indicate any anticipated impact on the State's operating revenues. [1] The bill focuses on appropriations from general revenues to fund the program. [1] No fees, fines, or other revenue-generating mechanisms are described in the Act. [1]
capital_expenditure_impact: The provided legislative document does not specify any capital expenditures for the program. [1] The appropriation is designated for equipment, services, and temporary positions, which are typically considered operating expenses. [1] There is no mention of facility construction, renovation, or other capital projects. [1]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: The women's court pilot program is established as a temporary, three-year program scheduled to be repealed on June 30, 2028. [1] The judiciary is required to submit recommendations regarding whether the program should continue, expand, provide additional services, or be discontinued. [1] Any ongoing fiscal obligations after the pilot period will depend entirely on future legislation based on these recommendations. [1]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: No previous fiscal note was provided for comparison. [1]
fte_positions: The bill provides for the establishment of seven temporary positions. [1] These positions include an unspecified number of full-time equivalent (FTE) social worker V positions, social worker IV positions, circuit court clerk II positions, and judicial clerk positions. [1] The specific allocation of the seven FTE positions among the different roles is not detailed in the bill. [1]
appropriations_changes: No previous version of the bill was provided, so changes to appropriations cannot be identified. [1] The bill appropriates an unspecified sum of money ($) from the general fund for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum for fiscal year 2026-2027. [1] The appropriation is for equipment, services, and seven temporary positions. [1]
funding_sources_changes: No previous version of the bill was provided, so changes to funding sources cannot be identified. [1] The bill specifies that the appropriation is made out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii. [1] There is no mention of any other funding sources or changes from previous funding methods. [1]
department_impact: No previous version of the bill was provided, so changes to departmental responsibility cannot be identified. [1] The bill states that the women's court pilot program is established within the second, third, and fifth circuits of the judiciary. [1] The sums appropriated shall be expended by the judiciary for the purposes of this Act. [1]
reports_required: The judiciary shall submit a report of its findings and recommendations, including any proposed legislation, to the governor and legislature. [1] This report is required no later than forty days prior to the convening of the regular sessions of 2026, 2027, and 2028. [1] The report must include the status of the program, participant numbers, and recommendations as to whether the pilot program should be continued, expanded, or discontinued. [1]
pilot_program: The purpose of this Act is to establish a three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the second, third, and fifth circuits. [1] The bill consistently refers to the program as a pilot program. [1] This new pilot program is modeled after a similar three-year pilot program in the first circuit established by Act 243, Session Laws of Hawaii 2022. [1]
sunset_date: This Act shall be repealed on June 30, 2028. [1] The bill's description confirms it sunsets on 6/30/2028. [1]
effective_date: This Act shall take effect on July 1, 2025. [1] No information regarding a defective or changed effective date from a previous version is provided. [1]
